meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny, folks! I'm here to dish out my thoughts on Moss: Book II, the latest adventure from Polyarc that's got everyone in VR land all aflutter.

First off, let me just say that I'm no stranger to the world of Moss. I mean, who can forget that first game's adorable protagonist Quill and her quest to save her friend? It was like playing with a virtual pet (but, you know, actually playing it). And now, with Book II, we're in for another delightful escapade.

But before I get into the nitty-gritty of this sequel, let me just say that my expectations were tempered by some of the reviews out there. I mean, IGN said it's a "nice" build upon the original, while Vandal called it "not as surprising" as the first game. SpazioGames even mentioned that PS VR feels like it didn't age so well (zing!). So, was Book II worth all the hype?

Well, let me tell you – I had an absolute blast playing through this game! The world is bigger and more interactive than ever before, with Quill facing off against new foes and making friends in equal measure. And that art direction? Stunning! It's like stepping into a hand-painted watercolor come to life.

Of course, not everyone is singing the same tune. Some critics have noted that the game is held back by small yet frustrating bugs (GamingTrend, I'm looking at you). And yeah, those tech issues can be pretty pesky. But hey, when it comes down to it, Moss: Book II is still a phenomenal adventure that'll keep you engaged and grinning from ear to ear.

All in all, I think Polyarc has done an incredible job of building upon the original's magic. And even if some folks might find it "not as surprising" or just "nice," I'm here to tell you – Moss: Book II is a treat that's well worth your time.

So there you have it, folks! Hippo Penny says Moss: Book II is a must-play VR adventure that'll leave you paws-itively hooked.
